alert.note: Alert for Chesterfield (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 10 at 10:08AM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Chesterfield County through 1045 AM EDT... At 1008 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Cheraw Municipal Airport, or 7 miles southwest of Cheraw, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Cheraw, Chesterfield, Cheraw State Park, Cheraw Municipal Airport, Northeastern Technical College, Society Hill, Patrick, McFarlan, Cheraw Fish Hatchery, and Chesterfield Detention Center. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. Theis type of funnel cloud is harmless, but on rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors and report your sighting to the National Weather Service. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
